Plot:

A story inspired by actual events in a Filipino prison, the struggles that inmates experience and 
their quest to feel human again. This riveting feature film about redemption follows Frank Parish 
(Patrick Bergin), a retired US fireman and philanthropist who finds himself wrongly accused of 
murder and jailed in the Philippines. Stuck in prison, Frank was beginning to lose faith in 
everything he believed in until he becomes friends with Mando (Dingdong Dantes), a convicted 
murderer who denies his passion for dancing just to prove his masculinity and Allona (Joey Paras), 
a transsexual who tries to contribute to prison reforms by teaching his fellow inmates dance exercises. 
They get involved in a tricky struggle between the positive changes initiated by the new warden 
(Ricky Davao) and the corrupt system that weighs down the inmates' chance to become better individuals. 
Frank finds himself caught in an intricate web of lies and must choose between concealing 
what he knows to keep himself ...
